results.title: Mozart's House
results.creator_credit: Jack Patterson, Clean Film and Channel 4
results.brief_description: Made during Moscow’s biggest ever heat wave when the smog was thick and Red Square was actually red. The song was sung very slowly, the footage was then sped up to reflect the high energy vocals and the synths lines that sound almost randomised.
results.description: Made during Moscow’s biggest ever heat wave when the smog was thick and Red Square was actually red. The song was sung very slowly, the footage was then sped up to reflect the high energy vocals and the synths lines that sound almost randomised.

results.title: We are the People
results.brief_description: The choir brings together Akala, PGR, Beardyman, Wretch 32, Ms Dynamite and Lady Leshurr with members of the YouTube community who uploaded performances to the YouTube channel. Together they perform an original track made by the human voice.

results.title: The Voorman Problem
results.creator_credit: Baldwin Li, Mark Gill, Alastair Connolly and Honlodge
results.brief_description: Doctor Williams, a psychiatrist, is called to a prison to examine Voorman – an inmate with a peculiar affliction – he believes he is a god. The problem is, though, that he’s managed to convince the rest of the prison population that he is indeed telling the truth.

results.title: Here to Fall
results.creator_credit: Jim Agnew, Kris Kelly, Evelyn McGrath, Blacknorth, Arts Council (Ireland) and Irish Film Board
results.brief_description: A girl falls through darkness. A signal is broadcast, it’s a call. City wires connect and vibrate. The digital signal holds her, dropping her to a city’s rooftops that builds around her. She recognises it, and she’s safe, but for how long?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jim Agnew, Kris Kelly, Evelyn McGrath, Blacknorth, Arts Council (Ireland) and Irish Film Board

results.title: Hollywood Costume: Interview with Jan Chapman and Janet Patterson
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description:
The 2009 film ‘Bright Star’ (directed by Jane Campion) tells the story of the romance between the English poet John Keats (1795 - 1821) and Fanny Brawne.
In this interview, ‘Bright Star’ producer Jan Chapman and costume designer Janet Patterson discuss the creative process behind costume design, and the design choices that went into making one of the costumes for the character Fanny Brawne (played in the film by Abbie Cornish).
The character’s crimson gown costume was on display during the ACMI Melbourne Winter Masterpieces ‘Hollywood Costume’ exhibition (2013).
Clips from ‘Bright Star’ (2009) courtesy of Hopscotch Films.
